condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Families are aware of quality ECD & Family services, and provide nurturing and responsive care to young children (0-6 years), in targeted districts

description.narrative: A total of 382,238 families participated in the integrated ECD programme, an increase from 19,629 in 2019. The increase is due to continued implementation of UNICEF supported eight partnerships with CSOs and the national multi-media ECD campaign on social and behaviour change. The parents acquired skills and knowledge to provide nurturing care. A 2017 UNICEF supported study in 10 districts showed that 57 per cent of children have fathers engaged in childcare compared to 49 per cent in 2015. UNICEF is supporting national Demographic Health Survey which will provide national latest data by the end of this year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020
